document.docAuthor: Salvatierra, Lidianne, Tourinho, Ana Lúcia & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new synonyms of the spider Miagrammopes guttatus Mello-Leitão, 1937 (Araneae: Uloboridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new synonyms of the spider Miagrammopes guttatus Mello-Leitão, 1937 (Araneae: Uloboridae)

bibRefCitation.author: Mello-Leitao
bibRefCitation.refString: Mello-Leitao, C. F. de. (1937) Aranhas novas ou raras. Annaes de Academia Brasileira de Sciencias, 9, 1 - 12.

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 1 – 2. Miagrammopes guttatus Mello-Leitão, 1937. Male, left palp (IBSP 150939). 1, prolateral. 2, retrolateral view. Abbreviations: AM 1 (Median apophysis 1), AM 2 (Median apophysis 2), E (Embolus), Cym (Cymbium), Co (Conductor). Scale bars = 0.25 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 3 – 6. Miagrammopes guttatus Mello-Leitão, 1937. Female, epigynum. 3, ventral view. 4, ventral view, dissected. 5, dorsal view, dissected. 6, ventral view, cleared. Arrow indicates rim of epigynum. Scale bars = 0.25 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURES 7 – 11. Miagrammopes guttatus Mello-Leitão, 1937. Female. 7, Left Metatarsus IV, prolateral. 8 - 11, Male. 8, Left Tibia IV, prolateral. 9, Left Tibia I, retrolateral. 10, Left Tibia I, prolateral. 11, Left Metatarsus I, dorsal. Scale bar = 0.10 mm.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Miagrammopes guttatus
Mello-Leitão, 1937
: 5
figs. 6−11 ;
Platnick, 2011
( holotype male from Corumbataí,
22 º 13 ' 12 "S
47 º 37 ' 33 "W
, São Paulo, Brazil , deposited in IBSP 228 , lost, not examined);

Miagrammopes correai
Piza, 1944
: 263
, figs. 1−2 ;
Platnick, 2011
(male, female and seven juvenile syntypes from Piracicaba,
22 º 43 ' 31 "S
47 º 38 ' 57 "W
, São Paulo, Brazil , deposited in IBSP 138213 . Lectotype male and paralectotype female, here designed, and seven juveniles, examined). New Synonymy.

Miagrammopes zenzesi
Mello-Leitão, 1945
: 229
. fig. 5 ;
Lehtinen, 1967
: 266
;
Opell, 1984
: 235
, figs. 29, 39− 41 ;
Grismado, 2008
: 100
, fig. 10 ;
Platnick, 2011
( holotype male from Puerto Victoria, 26 ° 19 ˏ 60 ʺS 54 ° 38 ˏ 60 ʺW, Misiones, Argentina , C. Zenzes leg., deposited in
MLP 16335
, examined). New Synonymy.

Miagrammopes lacteovittatus
Mello-Leitão, 1947
: 3
, fig. 24, 38− 39 ;
Platnick, 2011
(male and four female syntypes from Carmo do Rio Claro, 20 ° 58 ˏ 23 ʺS 46 ° 7 ˏ 8 ʺW, Minas Gerais, Brazil , 1947 , C. M. Carvalho leg., deposited in MNRJ 1480 , examined. Lectotype female here designated ( MNRJ 1480 ); the syntype male ( MNRJ 1480 A) belongs to a new species and will be described in the future). New Synonymy.

Diagnosis. Males of
Miagrammopes guttatus
can be distinguished from other species of this genus by its median apophysis I with a large base, tapering gradually towards the apex and ending in a slightly curved tip; median apophysis II smaller than the median apophysis I, and curved at terminal end (
Fig. 2
); and by the convex cymbium, in form of a wide leaf presenting two thick setae on its anterior margin (
Fig. 1
). Females are similar to
M. luederwaldti
(see
Mello-Leitão, 1925
, Fig. 34 ) in having an epigynum weakly sclerotized and the presence of an anterior median rim, but differ by having the anterior median rim separated from the epigynum’s anterior margin by a distance 2.5 times (equivalent to the diameter of the spermathecae) and by the absence of a posterior epyginal projection. Internally the epigynum is distinguished from the remaining
Miagrammopes
by thin, long and sinuous copulatory ducts, which are twisted on the apex near to the connection with the oval spermathecae (
Figs. 3−6
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–2.
Miagrammopes guttatus Mello-Leitão, 1937
. Male, left palp (IBSP 150939). 1, prolateral. 2, retrolateral view. Abbreviations: AM1 (Median apophysis 1), AM2 (Median apophysis 2), E (Embolus), Cym (Cymbium), Co (Conductor). Scale bars = 0.25 mm.

FIGURES 3–6.
Miagrammopes guttatus Mello-Leitão, 1937
. Female, epigynum. 3, ventral view. 4, ventral view, dissected. 5, dorsal view, dissected. 6, ventral view, cleared. Arrow indicates rim of epigynum. Scale bars = 0.25 mm.

FIGURES 7–11.
Miagrammopes guttatus Mello-Leitão, 1937
. Female. 7, Left Metatarsus IV, prolateral. 8-11, Male. 8, Left Tibia IV, prolateral. 9, Left Tibia I, retrolateral. 10, Left Tibia I, prolateral. 11, Left Metatarsus I, dorsal. Scale bar = 0.10 mm.

FIGURE 12. Map of Brazil showing the known distribution of
Miagrammopes guttatus
(black circles).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female ( IBSP
150939
):
Total length 4.75 . Coloration as in male, except for the anterior depression of the carapace not darkish, abdomen with irregular white spots dispersed throughout its length, sides and ventral abdomen yellowish brown.
Carapace length 1.72 , width 1.21 , as in male except by the more obvious laterals depressions on the clypeus and on the posterior margin of the ocular tubercle.
